titleInfo.title: Letter no. 1759 of 1822 from Secretary to Government of India to Lieutenant John MacLeod, Resident in the Persian Gulph [Gulf]

physicalDescription.extent: Condition: Text on the lower part of the recto side of the page is missing due to insect damage.

mods.abstract: Refers to his letter of 9 November 1822 advising pensions should be granted to members of the family of the late Mehedy Ally Khan [Mahdī ‘Alī Khān] and informs MacLeod that an application has been received from Mariam [Mariyam], a widow of the late Mahomed Hussain Khan [Muḥammad Ḥusayn Khān], son of Mehedy Ally Khan, who asks that her pension may be paid in Bombay.
